faqs.title: DrawPen is a desktop app that runs locally on your machine.
faqs.content: It doesn’t try to replace your presentation software — it just adds a simple annotation layer on top of whatever you're already using.

faqs.title: Is DrawPen free?
faqs.content: Yes. DrawPen is free and open source under the MIT license.

faqs.title: Which platforms are supported?
faqs.content: macOS, Windows and Linux. You can download builds from GitHub Releases or install via package managers like Homebrew, Scoop and AUR.

faqs.title: Can I customize shortcuts?
faqs.content: Yes. There is a dedicated settings page where you can adjust keybindings for global activation and tools.

faqs.title: Where can I report bugs or suggest features?
faqs.content: Issues and feature requests are tracked on GitHub. Open an issue in the DrawPen repository with a short description and, if possible, steps to reproduce.

faqs.title: How do I install DrawPen?
faqs.content: Download from GitHub Releases. On macOS use Homebrew (drawpen cask), on Windows use Scoop, and all platforms support manual installation.

faqs.title: How do I show or hide DrawPen?
faqs.content: Use CMD/CTRL + SHIFT + A to toggle the overlay.

faqs.title: On which platforms does DrawPen work?
faqs.content: DrawPen works on macOS, Windows, and Linux. Installers are available on GitHub.

faqs.title: What tools are available for drawing?
faqs.content: Pen, Shapes, Text, Highlighter, Laser, and Eraser. Each tool has a number key shortcut.

faqs.title: How do I change the color or thickness of the stroke?
faqs.content: Press 7 to cycle colors and 8 to change line thickness.

faqs.title: How do I clear everything I have drawn on the screen?
faqs.content: Press CMD or CTRL + K to clear all annotations.

faqs.title: How do I show or hide the toolbar?
faqs.content: Press CMD or CTRL + T to toggle toolbar visibility.

faqs.title: How do I open the Settings page?
faqs.content: Press CMD or CTRL + , (comma) to open Settings.

faqs.title: Is there a whiteboard mode?
faqs.content: Yes. Press CMD or CTRL + E to open a blank whiteboard canvas.

faqs.title: Can DrawPen annotate on top of any application?
faqs.content: Yes. It draws on a transparent overlay above any content.

faqs.title: How can I save my annotations?
faqs.content: Currently you must use your OS screenshot tool. Exporting features may come in future versions.

faqs.title: Can I customize shortcuts, colors, and drawing options?
faqs.content: Yes. Settings allow configuration of hotkeys, colors, widths, UI elements, toolbar position and more.

faqs.title: What license does DrawPen use?
faqs.content: DrawPen is licensed under MIT.

faqs.title: What should I do if I encounter bugs or unexpected behavior?
faqs.content: Check GitHub Issues, and if needed create a new issue or submit a PR.

faqs.title: Why should I use DrawPen?
faqs.content: DrawPen is lightweight, cross-platform, ideal for presentations, coding sessions, tutorials, and technical explanations, and is fully open-source and extensible.
